content: One option is to NOT enter password until you attempt to access account. That gives time to adjust settings. Sync'ing only recent number of days can help and you can also set which folders are NOT to be accessed offline. If the account already exists, another option is to exit thunderbird and, in windows file explorer (assuming windows), delete the folder and it's .msf entry. restart thunderbird and folder will repopulate according to the settings.
creator: davidsk

content: I regret to inform you, but this forum is the only media offered. Perhaps, if you describe you problem, someone here can assist. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
I can answer my own question here if it helps anybody else.

Somewhere I found dialogue that allowed Thunderbird to 'Look Up' the configuration of my yahoo account, once that was done everything was sorted out and the folders where all there.

I searched again but was unable to find that dialouge, but I had manually changed the Server Name to the same as on the old computer I.E: imap.mail.yahoo.com. Maybe that had to be done first.
creator: ironboat

content: Fai click con il pulsante destro del mouse sulla cartella di Thunderbird chiamata Cartelle locali Nel menù contestuale che si apre scegli Nuova cartella e creati una cartella col nome che preferisci. Ripeti la procedura se ti servono altre cartelle. Puoi spostare le mail in questa cartelle semplicemente trascinandole con il mouse. Se vuoi che Thunderbird lo faccia automaticamente puoi usare i filtri -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/organizzare-messaggi-posta-thundebird-filtri In particolare ti suggerisco di creare un filtro che faccia una copia della posta nelle cartelle che hai creato e non un filtro che sposti direttamente i messaggi.
creator: @next

content: Occorre che tu fornisca maggiori dettagli. Anzitutto, cosa riporta esattamente la finestra in cui ti viene chiesta la password? Inoltre, hai memorizzato da qualche parte la password dei tuoi account? E ancora chi è il servizio che gestisce i tuoi account?

content: If this is a gmail account, one of the settings is online, specifying delete options . I suggest checking online and also Thunderbird to just have setting to 'move to trash
